issue.title: animego.vip
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://animego.vip/3417-ja-stal-obrazcom-prostoljudina-v-shkole-blagorodnyh-devic.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fanimego.vip%2F3417-ja-stal-obrazcom-prostoljudina-v-shkole-blagorodnyh-devic.html) ### Comment > Просто начать смотреть. Проблема в плеере kodik. Заблокировать в ручном режиме не представляется возможным, по причине что блокируется весь iframe, где и идет воспроизведение видео. Потому что плеер реагирует на интерфейс адблока и невозможно что-либо выбрать, ибо вместо плеера подставляется какая-то фигня, а после скрытия выбора адгуарда, то плеер по новой загружается(сбросив свое состояние просмотра). > > P.s чуть полазив, обнаружил такой момент. Что поверх видео открывается второе видео. > Почему-то по умолчанию он не блокирует его. Вот div контейнер с рекламой: >
...
> > А вот с основным видео: >
...
> > > Т.е надо блокировать и сортировать класс adv-player, adv_clickable. > > Попробую сам написать правило, но хотел бы, чтобы правило было стандартным > > IP российский. Username: `@niazlv` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hyhe1e6cc68gw4cscs0ws0c84w0wkssbvazvxrfdu8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/q1wmu5wcd28ggwo04o4cgs8www0w88o4mllwq7u9u2.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=fsybdi3kj8g8edr&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Flifestyle%2Fcareers%2Fai-job-application-685f29f7%3Fst%3Dfsybdi3kj8g8edr%26reflink%3Dmobilewebshare_permalink) ### Comment > The AdGuard Social Media filter causes issues for The Wall Street Journal (wsj.com) when I want to obtain an "Unlocked Link" to share with people. I have a free subscription that's through an educational institution so I make use of it by sharing no paywall links, like the below: > > https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=oo90f1uo7tqdv9f&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink > > However, on both desktop with uBlock Origin & Android on AdGuard, the AdGuard Social Media filter will totally block the share button, making it impossible to get the Unlocked Article link. > > I've enabled it and disabled it and tested repeatedly, I understand the desire to ban the bad social widgets but the WSJ one has a very useful need to exist. > > If this could be adjusted for both desktop & mobile I would love it. comment.body:
> @vonDubenshire Blocking social widget is an intended behavior of AdGuard Social filter. If you want to share a URL with bypassing paywall, please disable the filter.

I understand, but I do not have this issue with another website I can share unlocked articles with -- "nytimes.com" , where the Unlocked Article sharing is still there with the social filter enabled (mobile and desktop).  

I was looking for any minor modification that could be made or exception for this particular type of share widget, since it is so non-invasive. 

The type of share widget I always assumed the filter was intended for are things like the global share widget websites, or the garbage you see on an unfiltered AndroidPolice page: 

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/40748193/4d743d6e-5421-4965-81e9-232f6cf9326d)
 
Anyway, is that a possibility or do I need to just accept I'll need a user rule for that if I want to keep using the social widget filter.  

I noticed Fanboy's does not block that particular one, by the way, though I do not know the intricacies of the difference in his and AdGuard's. 

Thanks for the reply!

comment.body:
> Hi I can't reproduce it. Is the problem related to enabled filters?

Alex, sorry that I did not reply back in August 2023.  However, I have continued to have this issue with both uBlock Origin default filters and my custom ones, as well as AdGuard with a clean installation of default filters. 

It **could** be a filter issue but I have yet to figure out which one it is by toggling on a single one at a time.

I have found that telling your browser to block JavaScript for "www.theatlantic.com" **will** block the paywall sign-in from loading (it must be www., for whatever reason, at least in Chromium browsers). 

I still have the same sign-in as I showed above on almost every article at www.theatlantic.com 

If you are still unable to reproduce, let me know how best to start testing to diagnose if\which filter this may be from. 

I have the same issue(s) on any browser on any device (I use macOS, ChromeOS, Windows 11, iOS and Android -- all with various browsers, but mostly Chrome.)

issue.title: www.wsj.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=fsybdi3kj8g8edr&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Flifestyle%2Fcareers%2Fai-job-application-685f29f7%3Fst%3Dfsybdi3kj8g8edr%26reflink%3Dmobilewebshare_permalink) ### Comment > The AdGuard Social Media filter causes issues for The Wall Street Journal (wsj.com) when I want to obtain an "Unlocked Link" to share with people. I have a free subscription that's through an educational institution so I make use of it by sharing no paywall links, like the below: > > https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=oo90f1uo7tqdv9f&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink > > However, on both desktop with uBlock Origin & Android on AdGuard, the AdGuard Social Media filter will totally block the share button, making it impossible to get the Unlocked Article link. > > I've enabled it and disabled it and tested repeatedly, I understand the desire to ban the bad social widgets but the WSJ one has a very useful need to exist. > > If this could be adjusted for both desktop & mobile I would love it. Thank you. Let me know if there are any questions. Username: `@vondubenshire` ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=fsybdi3kj8g8edr&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Flifestyle%2Fcareers%2Fai-job-application-685f29f7%3Fst%3Dfsybdi3kj8g8edr%26reflink%3Dmobilewebshare_permalink) ### Comment > The AdGuard Social Media filter causes issues for The Wall Street Journal (wsj.com) when I want to obtain an "Unlocked Link" to share with people. I have a free subscription that's through an educational institution so I make use of it by sharing no paywall links, like the below: > > https://www.wsj.com/lifestyle/careers/ai-job-application-685f29f7?st=oo90f1uo7tqdv9f&reflink=mobilewebshare_permalink > > However, on both desktop with uBlock Origin & Android on AdGuard, the AdGuard Social Media filter will totally block the share button, making it impossible to get the Unlocked Article link. > > I've enabled it and disabled it and tested repeatedly, I understand the desire to ban the bad social widgets but the WSJ one has a very useful need to exist. > > If this could be adjusted for both desktop & mobile I would love it. issue.title: animego.vip
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://animego.vip/3417-ja-stal-obrazcom-prostoljudina-v-shkole-blagorodnyh-devic.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fanimego.vip%2F3417-ja-stal-obrazcom-prostoljudina-v-shkole-blagorodnyh-devic.html) ### Comment > Просто начать смотреть. Проблема в плеере kodik. Заблокировать в ручном режиме не представляется возможным, по причине что блокируется весь iframe, где и идет воспроизведение видео. Потому что плеер реагирует на интерфейс адблока и невозможно что-либо выбрать, ибо вместо плеера подставляется какая-то фигня, а после скрытия выбора адгуарда, то плеер по новой загружается(сбросив свое состояние просмотра). > > P.s чуть полазив, обнаружил такой момент. Что поверх видео открывается второе видео. > Почему-то по умолчанию он не блокирует его. Вот div контейнер с рекламой: >
...
> > А вот с основным видео: >
...
> > > Т.е надо блокировать и сортировать класс adv-player, adv_clickable. > > Попробую сам написать правило, но хотел бы, чтобы правило было стандартным > > IP российский. Username: `@niazlv` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Реклама не повторяется, насколько я вижу рекламные запросы уже заблокированы. Попробуйте оставить только фильтры Адгард, обновить их, затем очистите данные приложения и перезапустите его.
Если реклама останется, вполне похоже на то, что она встроенная. В таком случае сайт лучше открыть через браузер.

comment.body:
This website requires to accept cookie notice, otherwise some elements will not load, related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/125097
It's fixed by "advanced" rules which are not supported by content blockers.
Please install AdGuard for Android from - https://adguard.com/adguard-android/overview.html

comment.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
> Facebook — 53K, Youtube — 23,2K, Similarweb за апрель — 20K...

Подписчиков мало и в социальных сетях, даже не под 100K. Я добавлю правило для кнопок "поделиться" и "подписаться", но баннер о партнерском предложении не выглядит как раздражитель. Это кнопка обратной связи около футера, не загораживающая контент.

Пожалуйста, обращайте внимание на политику составления фильтров, она была недавно обновлена и содержит достаточно критериев для определения того, попадает ли сайт под нее.

comment.body:
I cannot reproduce it.
It's fixed by this rule:
```adblock
softonic.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie-reload', 'euconsent-v2', 'CP2APYAP2APYAAHABBENAcEgAAAAAAAAAAiQAAAAAAEEoAMAARBqDQAYAAiDUKgAwABEGopABgACINQ6ADAAEQaiEAGAAIg1BIAMAARBqGQAYAAiDUAA.YAAAAAAAAAAA')
```
on my end.
And even if I disable that rule, then it's correctly closed by `trusted-click-element` scriptlet.

Please try to add these rules:
```adblock
softonic.com#@%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '.didomi-consent-popup-actions > button.didomi-components-button:not(.highlight-button)')
softonic.com#@%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#didomi-notice-learn-more-button')
softonic.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#didomi-notice-learn-more-button, .didomi-consent-popup-actions > button.didomi-components-button:not(.highlight-button)')
```
to user rules and then check if cookie notice is closed correctly.

issue.title: novinky.cz - cookie popup
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

If you visit novinky.cz, popup saying "Abyste mohli pokračovat, potřebujeme vědět, jakou formou vám můžeme zobrazovat reklamu" (translated "In order for you to proceed, we need to know how we can show you advertising") will appear shortly after visiting the website.

### Proposed solution

I made filter for this (but it needs more testing, not sure, if it breaks something, it didn't break anything for me, but we cannot be 100% sure)
```
||cmp.seznam.cz^$3p
```

### Additional information

This is also related to #177571

comment.body: Maybe the visitor will encounter https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178995#issuecomment-2105683410.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
